trans-unit.source: Getting started with Azure storage and Visual Studio connected services (WebJob projects)
trans-unit.target: Getting started with Azure storage and Visual Studio connected services (WebJob projects)

trans-unit.target: How to get started using Blob storage in an Azure storage account that was created using Visual Studio's Add Connected Services dialog box in a WebJob project.

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This article provides C# code samples that show how to trigger a process when an Azure blob is created or updated.
trans-unit.target: This article provides C# code samples that show how to trigger a process when an Azure blob is created or updated.

trans-unit.source: The code samples use the [WebJobs SDK](websites-dotnet-webjobs-sdk.md) version 1.x.
trans-unit.target: The code samples use the [WebJobs SDK](websites-dotnet-webjobs-sdk.md) version 1.x.

trans-unit.source: When you add a storage account to a WebJob project by using the Visual Studio **Add Connected Services** dialog, the appropriate Azure Storage NuGet package is installed, the appropriate .NET references are added to the project, and connection strings for the storage account are updated in the App.config file.
trans-unit.target: When you add a storage account to a WebJob project by using the Visual Studio **Add Connected Services** dialog, the appropriate Azure Storage NuGet package is installed, the appropriate .NET references are added to the project, and connection strings for the storage account are updated in the App.config file.

trans-unit.source: How to trigger a function when a blob is created or updated
trans-unit.target: How to trigger a function when a blob is created or updated

trans-unit.source: This section shows how to use the `BlobTrigger` attribute.
trans-unit.target: This section shows how to use the `BlobTrigger` attribute.

trans-unit.source: **Note:** The WebJobs SDK scans log files to watch for new or changed blobs.
trans-unit.target: **Note:** The WebJobs SDK scans log files to watch for new or changed blobs.

trans-unit.source: This process is inherently slow; a function might not get triggered until several minutes or longer after the blob is created.
trans-unit.target: This process is inherently slow; a function might not get triggered until several minutes or longer after the blob is created.

trans-unit.source: If your application needs to process blobs immediately, the recommended method is to create a queue message when you create the blob, and use the [QueueTrigger](websites-dotnet-webjobs-sdk-storage-queues-how-to.md#trigger) attribute instead of the `BlobTrigger` attribute on the function that processes the blob.
trans-unit.target: If your application needs to process blobs immediately, the recommended method is to create a queue message when you create the blob, and use the [QueueTrigger](websites-dotnet-webjobs-sdk-storage-queues-how-to.md#trigger) attribute instead of the `BlobTrigger` attribute on the function that processes the blob.

trans-unit.source: Single placeholder for blob name with extension
trans-unit.target: Single placeholder for blob name with extension

trans-unit.source: The following code sample copies text blobs that appear in the *input* container to the *output* container:
trans-unit.target: The following code sample copies text blobs that appear in the *input* container to the *output* container:

trans-unit.source: The attribute constructor takes a string parameter that specifies the container name and a placeholder for the blob name.
trans-unit.target: The attribute constructor takes a string parameter that specifies the container name and a placeholder for the blob name.

trans-unit.source: In this example, if a blob named *Blob1.txt* is created in the *input* container, the function creates a blob named *Blob1.txt* in the *output* container.
trans-unit.target: In this example, if a blob named *Blob1.txt* is created in the *input* container, the function creates a blob named *Blob1.txt* in the *output* container.

trans-unit.source: You can specify a name pattern with the blob name placeholder, as shown in the following code sample:
trans-unit.target: You can specify a name pattern with the blob name placeholder, as shown in the following code sample:

trans-unit.source: This code copies only blobs that have names beginning with "original-".
trans-unit.target: This code copies only blobs that have names beginning with "original-".

trans-unit.source: For example, *original-Blob1.txt* in the *input* container is copied to *copy-Blob1.txt* in the *output* container.
trans-unit.target: For example, *original-Blob1.txt* in the *input* container is copied to *copy-Blob1.txt* in the *output* container.

trans-unit.source: If you need to specify a name pattern for blob names that have curly braces in the name, double the curly braces.
trans-unit.target: If you need to specify a name pattern for blob names that have curly braces in the name, double the curly braces.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to find blobs in the *images* container that have names like this:
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to find blobs in the *images* container that have names like this:

trans-unit.source: use this for your pattern:
trans-unit.target: use this for your pattern:

trans-unit.source: In the example, the *name* placeholder value would be *soundfile.mp3*.
trans-unit.target: In the example, the *name* placeholder value would be *soundfile.mp3*.

trans-unit.source: Separate blob name and extension placeholders
trans-unit.target: Separate blob name and extension placeholders

trans-unit.source: The following code sample changes the file extension as it copies blobs that appear in the *input* container to the *output* container.
trans-unit.target: The following code sample changes the file extension as it copies blobs that appear in the *input* container to the *output* container.

trans-unit.source: The code logs the extension of the *input* blob and sets the extension of the *output* blob to *.txt*.
trans-unit.target: The code logs the extension of the *input* blob and sets the extension of the *output* blob to *.txt*.

trans-unit.source: If you want to work directly with the Azure storage account, you can also add a `CloudStorageAccount` parameter to the method signature.
trans-unit.target: If you want to work directly with the Azure storage account, you can also add a `CloudStorageAccount` parameter to the method signature.

trans-unit.source: Getting text blob content by binding to string
trans-unit.target: Getting text blob content by binding to string

trans-unit.source: If text blobs are expected, `BlobTrigger` can be applied to a `string` parameter.
trans-unit.target: If text blobs are expected, `BlobTrigger` can be applied to a `string` parameter.

trans-unit.source: The following code sample binds a text blob to a `string` parameter named `logMessage`.
trans-unit.target: The following code sample binds a text blob to a `string` parameter named `logMessage`.

trans-unit.source: The function uses that parameter to write the contents of the blob to the WebJobs SDK dashboard.
trans-unit.target: The function uses that parameter to write the contents of the blob to the WebJobs SDK dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Getting serialized blob content by using ICloudBlobStreamBinder
trans-unit.target: Getting serialized blob content by using ICloudBlobStreamBinder

trans-unit.source: The following code sample uses a class that implements `ICloudBlobStreamBinder` to enable the `BlobTrigger` attribute to bind a blob to the `WebImage` type.
trans-unit.target: The following code sample uses a class that implements `ICloudBlobStreamBinder` to enable the `BlobTrigger` attribute to bind a blob to the `WebImage` type.

trans-unit.source: The `WebImage` binding code is provided in a `WebImageBinder` class that derives from `ICloudBlobStreamBinder`.
trans-unit.target: The `WebImage` binding code is provided in a `WebImageBinder` class that derives from `ICloudBlobStreamBinder`.

trans-unit.source: How to handle poison blobs
trans-unit.target: How to handle poison blobs

trans-unit.source: When a `BlobTrigger` function fails, the SDK calls it again, in case the failure was caused by a transient error.
trans-unit.target: When a `BlobTrigger` function fails, the SDK calls it again, in case the failure was caused by a transient error.

trans-unit.source: If the failure is caused by the content of the blob, the function fails every time it tries to process the blob.
trans-unit.target: If the failure is caused by the content of the blob, the function fails every time it tries to process the blob.

trans-unit.source: By default, the SDK calls a function up to 5 times for a given blob.
trans-unit.target: By default, the SDK calls a function up to 5 times for a given blob.

trans-unit.source: If the fifth try fails, the SDK adds a message to a queue named *webjobs-blobtrigger-poison*.
trans-unit.target: If the fifth try fails, the SDK adds a message to a queue named *webjobs-blobtrigger-poison*.

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of retries is configurable.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of retries is configurable.

trans-unit.source: The same [MaxDequeueCount](websites-dotnet-webjobs-sdk-storage-queues-how-to.md#configqueue) setting is used for poison blob handling and poison queue message handling.
trans-unit.target: The same [MaxDequeueCount](websites-dotnet-webjobs-sdk-storage-queues-how-to.md#configqueue) setting is used for poison blob handling and poison queue message handling.

trans-unit.source: The queue message for poison blobs is a JSON object that contains the following properties:
trans-unit.target: The queue message for poison blobs is a JSON object that contains the following properties:

trans-unit.source: FunctionId (in the format *{WebJob name}*.Functions.*{Function name}*, for example: WebJob1.Functions.CopyBlob)
trans-unit.target: FunctionId (in the format *{WebJob name}*.Functions.*{Function name}*, for example: WebJob1.Functions.CopyBlob)

trans-unit.source: BlobType ("BlockBlob" or "PageBlob")
trans-unit.target: BlobType ("BlockBlob" or "PageBlob")

trans-unit.source: ContainerName
trans-unit.target: ContainerName

trans-unit.source: BlobName
trans-unit.target: BlobName

trans-unit.source: ETag (a blob version identifier, for example: "0x8D1DC6E70A277EF")
trans-unit.target: ETag (a blob version identifier, for example: "0x8D1DC6E70A277EF")

trans-unit.source: In the following code sample, the `CopyBlob` function has code that causes it to fail every time it's called.
trans-unit.target: In the following code sample, the `CopyBlob` function has code that causes it to fail every time it's called.

trans-unit.source: After the SDK calls it for the maximum number of retries, a message is created on the poison blob queue, and that message is processed by the `LogPoisonBlob` function.
trans-unit.target: After the SDK calls it for the maximum number of retries, a message is created on the poison blob queue, and that message is processed by the `LogPoisonBlob` function.

trans-unit.source: The SDK automatically deserializes the JSON message.
trans-unit.target: The SDK automatically deserializes the JSON message.

trans-unit.source: Here is the `PoisonBlobMessage` class:
trans-unit.target: Here is the `PoisonBlobMessage` class:

trans-unit.source: Blob polling algorithm
trans-unit.target: Blob polling algorithm

trans-unit.source: The WebJobs SDK scans all containers specified by `BlobTrigger` attributes at application start.
trans-unit.target: The WebJobs SDK scans all containers specified by `BlobTrigger` attributes at application start.

trans-unit.source: In a large storage account this scan can take some time, so it might be a while before new blobs are found and `BlobTrigger` functions are executed.
trans-unit.target: In a large storage account this scan can take some time, so it might be a while before new blobs are found and `BlobTrigger` functions are executed.

trans-unit.source: To detect new or changed blobs after application start, the SDK periodically reads from the blob storage logs.
trans-unit.target: To detect new or changed blobs after application start, the SDK periodically reads from the blob storage logs.

trans-unit.source: The blob logs are buffered and only get physically written every 10 minutes or so, so there may be significant delay after a blob is created or updated before the corresponding `BlobTrigger` function executes.
trans-unit.target: The blob logs are buffered and only get physically written every 10 minutes or so, so there may be significant delay after a blob is created or updated before the corresponding `BlobTrigger` function executes.

trans-unit.source: There is an exception for blobs that you create by using the `Blob` attribute.
trans-unit.target: There is an exception for blobs that you create by using the `Blob` attribute.

trans-unit.source: When the WebJobs SDK creates a new blob, it passes the new blob immediately to any matching `BlobTrigger` functions.
trans-unit.target: When the WebJobs SDK creates a new blob, it passes the new blob immediately to any matching `BlobTrigger` functions.

trans-unit.source: Therefore if you have a chain of blob inputs and outputs, the SDK can process them efficiently.
trans-unit.target: Therefore if you have a chain of blob inputs and outputs, the SDK can process them efficiently.

trans-unit.source: But if you want low latency running your blob processing functions for blobs that are created or updated by other means, we recommend using `QueueTrigger` rather than `BlobTrigger`.
trans-unit.target: But if you want low latency running your blob processing functions for blobs that are created or updated by other means, we recommend using `QueueTrigger` rather than `BlobTrigger`.

trans-unit.source: Blob receipts
trans-unit.target: Blob receipts

trans-unit.source: The WebJobs SDK makes sure that no `BlobTrigger` function gets called more than once for the same new or updated blob.
trans-unit.target: The WebJobs SDK makes sure that no `BlobTrigger` function gets called more than once for the same new or updated blob.

trans-unit.source: It does this by maintaining *blob receipts* in order to determine if a given blob version has been processed.
trans-unit.target: It does this by maintaining *blob receipts* in order to determine if a given blob version has been processed.

trans-unit.source: Blob receipts are stored in a container named *azure-webjobs-hosts* in the Azure storage account specified by the AzureWebJobsStorage connection string.
trans-unit.target: Blob receipts are stored in a container named *azure-webjobs-hosts* in the Azure storage account specified by the AzureWebJobsStorage connection string.

trans-unit.source: A blob receipt has the following information:
trans-unit.target: A blob receipt has the following information:

trans-unit.source: The function that was called for the blob ("*{WebJob name}*.Functions.*{Function name}*", for example: "WebJob1.Functions.CopyBlob")
trans-unit.target: The function that was called for the blob ("*{WebJob name}*.Functions.*{Function name}*", for example: "WebJob1.Functions.CopyBlob")

trans-unit.source: The container name
trans-unit.target: The container name

trans-unit.source: The blob type ("BlockBlob" or "PageBlob")
trans-unit.target: The blob type ("BlockBlob" or "PageBlob")

trans-unit.source: The blob name
trans-unit.target: The blob name

trans-unit.source: The ETag (a blob version identifier, for example: "0x8D1DC6E70A277EF")
trans-unit.target: The ETag (a blob version identifier, for example: "0x8D1DC6E70A277EF")

trans-unit.source: If you want to force reprocessing of a blob, you can manually delete the blob receipt for that blob from the *azure-webjobs-hosts* container.
trans-unit.target: If you want to force reprocessing of a blob, you can manually delete the blob receipt for that blob from the *azure-webjobs-hosts* container.

trans-unit.source: Related topics covered by the queues article
trans-unit.target: Related topics covered by the queues article

trans-unit.source: For information about how to handle blob processing triggered by a queue message, or for WebJobs SDK scenarios not specific to blob processing, see [How to use Azure queue storage with the WebJobs SDK](websites-dotnet-webjobs-sdk-storage-queues-how-to.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about how to handle blob processing triggered by a queue message, or for WebJobs SDK scenarios not specific to blob processing, see [How to use Azure queue storage with the WebJobs SDK](websites-dotnet-webjobs-sdk-storage-queues-how-to.md).

trans-unit.target: This article has provided code samples that show how to handle common scenarios for working with Azure blobs.
